document.masterDocTitle: The aphrophorid spittlebugs of Iran (Hemiptera: Cercopoidea: Aphrophoridae)

Distribution and habitat. From the literature (
Melichar 1902
;
Dlabola 1958
, 1961 ,
1964 , 1965
,
1967 , 1970
,
1981
;
Nast 1972
) and the collecting data of the specimens examined the species has been found between the elevation 150m to 1600m , on
Alnus
,
Salix
, mixed plants near water and under the deciduous plants and the larvae have been collected on ground plants such as
Trifolium, Gypericum, Srigeron, Hieracium
and
Taraxacum
. The species was recorded as a pest on
Alnus
(
Abaii 2000
;
Modarres Awal 1994
). The species is also known as a potential vector for the bacterium
Xylella fastidiosa
(
European Food Safety Authority 2013
).

The species is known to be a common species with an Arboreal-transpalaearctic distribution, but rare in xerothermic areas.
Aphrophora alni
is recorded from Europe, Northern Africa, Western Asia, Iran (North, fig. 22 ), Central, Northern and Western Asia.
